file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 24-40-01-04 - EXTERNAL POWER RECEPTACLE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EXTERNAL POWER RECEPTACLE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the external power receptacle. B. The external power receptacle is located on the airplane nose left side. C. The access to the external power receptacle rear portion is through the main battery compartment door 113DL. D. You can get access to the external power receptacle forward portion through the external power receptacle door 113EL. E. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY EXTERNAL POWER RECEPTACLE - RE- ALL 24-40-01-000-801-A MOVAL EXTERNAL POWER RECEPTACLE - IN- ALL 24-40-01-400-801-A STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 24-40-01 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 24-40-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. EXTERNAL POWER RECEPTACLE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the external power receptacle. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 113 113DL - Main Battery Compartment Door Forward Fuselage Section I 113 113EL - External Power Receptacle Door Forward Fuselage Section I D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward Fuselage Section I I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the GPU pushbutton, on overhead panel, is set to OFF. (2) Attach a DO-NOT-SET-ON tag to the GPU pushbutton. (3) Make sure that the BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches, on the overhead panel, are set to OFF. (4) Attach a DO-NOT-SET-AUTO tag to the BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches. (5) Open the main battery compartment door 113DL (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (6) Open external power receptacle door 113EL (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 24-40-01 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the nuts (7) and (12), the lock washers (6) and (13) and washers (5) and (14) which attach the electrical cables (4) and (15) to the external power receptacle (23). (2) Remove the nut (8), the lock washer (9) and the washer (10) that attach the connection bar (20) to the external power receptacle (23). (3) Remove the electrical cables (4) and (15), the connection bar (20), and the insulator (11) from the external power receptacle (23). (4) If you remove the electrical cable (19) from the connection bar (20), remove the bolt (16), the lock washer (17), the washers (18) and (21), and the nut (22). (5) Remove the nuts (3) bolts (1), and washers (2) which attach the external power receptacle (23) to the airplane. (6) Remove the external power receptacle (23) from the compartment. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 24-40-01 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL External Power Receptacle - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ACCESS DOOR 113EL ZONE 113 B 16. BOLT 17. LOCK WASHER 18. WASHER DET. A 20. CONNECTION BAR 1 21. WASHER 8. NUT 9. LOCK WASHER 3 19. ELECTRICAL 22. NUT 10. WASHER CABLE (2) DET. C 2 13. LOCK WASHER 12. NUT C 14. WASHER 15. ELECTRICAL WIRE 1 11. INSULATOR 7. NUT 6. LOCK WASHER 5. WASHER 4. ELECTRICAL CABLE (2) 3. NUT (4) 23. EXTERNAL POWER RECEPTACLE 1 TORQUE: 12.4-13.4 Nm (110-120 lb.in) 2. WASHER (8) DET. B 1. BOLT (4) 2 TORQUE: 3.4-4.4 Nm (30-40 lb.in) 3 TORQUE: 14.1-15.8 Nm (125-140 lb.in) EM145AMM240115C.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 24-40-01 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 24-40-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. EXTERNAL POWER RECEPTACLE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the external power receptacle. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 113 113DL - Main Battery Compartment Forward Fuselage Section I 113 113EL - External Power Receptacle Forward Fuselage Section I D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench (For the torque range, To torque available refer to Figure 401) E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward Fuselage Section I I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the external power receptacle (23) in place, through the main battery compartment. (2) Attach the external power receptacle (23) in place, with the bolts (1), washers (2), and nuts (3). (3) Connect the electrical cables (4) and (15), to the external power receptacle (23), and put the insulator (11) in the position. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 24-40-01 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Attach the electrical cables (4) and (15) to the external power receptacle (23) with the washers (5) and (14), the lock washers (6) and (13), and nuts (7) and (12). (5) If you removed the the electrical cable (19) from the connection bar (20), install the lock washer (17), the washers (18) and (21), the bolt (16) and the nut (22). (6) Install the washer (10), the lock washer (9), and the nut (8) that attach the connection bar (20) to the external power receptacle (23). (7) Tighten the nuts (7), (8), (12) and (22) to the torque specified (Figure 401). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close main battery compartment door 113DL (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (2) Close external power receptacle door 113EL (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (3) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-ON tag from the GPU pushbutton. (4) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-AUTO tag from the BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 24-40-01 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
